verses.verse: Furthermore Elihu <S%H453><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
Hear <S%H8085><s%> my words, <S%H4405><s%> O you wise <S%H2450><s%> men; and give ear <S%H238><s%> to me, you that have knowledge. <S%H3045><s%>
For the ear <S%H241><s%> tries <S%H974><s%> words, <S%H4405><s%> as the mouth <S%H2441><s%> tastes <S%H2938><s%> meat. <S%H398><s%>
Let us choose <S%H977><s%> to us judgment: <S%H4941><s%> let us know <S%H3045><s%> among <S%H996><s%> ourselves what <S%H4100><s%> is good. <S%H2896><s%>
For Job <S%H347><s%> has said, <S%H559><s%> I am righteous: <S%H6663><s%> and God <S%H410><s%> has taken <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> my judgment. <S%H4941><s%>
Should I lie <S%H3576><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> my right? <S%H4941><s%> my wound <S%H2671><s%> is incurable <S%H605><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> transgression. <S%H6588><s%>
What <S%H4310><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> is like Job, <S%H347><s%> who drinks <S%H8354><s%> up scorning <S%H3933><s%> like water? <S%H4325><s%>
Which goes <S%H732><s%> in company <S%H2274><s%> with the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity, <S%H205><s%> and walks <S%H3212><s%> with wicked <S%H7562><s%> men. <S%H582><s%>
For he has said, <S%H559><s%> It profits <S%H5532><s%> a man <S%H1397><s%> nothing <S%H3808><s%> that he should delight <S%H7521><s%> himself with God. <S%H430><s%>

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me you men <S%H582><s%> of understanding: <S%H3824><s%> far <S%H2486><s%> be it from God, <S%H410><s%> that he should do wickedness; <S%H7562><s%> and from the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> that he should commit iniquity. <S%H5766><s%>
For the work <S%H6467><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%> shall he render <S%H7999><s%> to him, and cause every man <S%H376><s%> to find <S%H4672><s%> according to his ways. <S%H734><s%>
Yes, <S%H637><s%> surely <S%H551><s%> God <S%H410><s%> will not do wickedly, <S%H7561><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> will the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> judgment. <S%H4941><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> has given him a charge <S%H6485><s%> over the earth? <S%H776><s%> or who <S%H4310><s%> has disposed <S%H7760><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> world? <S%H8398><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> he set <S%H7760><s%> his heart <S%H3820><s%> on man, if he gather <S%H622><s%> to himself his spirit <S%H7307><s%> and his breath; <S%H5397><s%>
All <S%H3605><s%> flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall perish <S%H1478><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> and man <S%H120><s%> shall turn <S%H7725><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> to dust. <S%H6083><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> now you have understanding, <S%H998><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> this: <S%H2063><s%> listen <S%H238><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my words. <S%H4405><s%>
Shall even <S%H637><s%> he that hates <S%H8130><s%> right <S%H4941><s%> govern? <S%H2280><s%> and will you condemn <S%H7561><s%> him that is most <S%H3524><s%> just? <S%H6662><s%>
Is it fit to say <S%H559><s%> to a king, <S%H4428><s%> You are wicked? <S%H1100><s%> and to princes, <S%H5081><s%> You are ungodly? <S%H7563><s%>

How <S%H834><s%> much less to him that accepts <S%H5375><s%> not the persons <S%H6440><s%> of princes, <S%H8269><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> regards <S%H5234><s%> the rich <S%H7771><s%> more <S%H6440><s%> than <S%H6440><s%> the poor? <S%H1800><s%> for they all <S%H3605><s%> are the work <S%H4639><s%> of his hands. <S%H3027><s%>

In a moment <S%H7281><s%> shall they die, <S%H4191><s%> and the people <S%H5971><s%> shall be troubled <S%H1607><s%> at midnight, <S%H2676><s%> <S%H3915><s%> and pass <S%H5674><s%> away: and the mighty <S%H47><s%> shall be taken <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> hand. <S%H3027><s%>
For his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are on the ways <S%H1870><s%> of man, <S%H376><s%> and he sees <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his goings. <S%H6806><s%>

There is no <S%H369><s%> darkness, <S%H2822><s%> nor <S%H369><s%> shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death, <S%H6757><s%> where <S%H8033><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> may hide <S%H5641><s%> themselves.
For he will not lay <S%H7760><s%> on man <S%H376><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> than right; that he should enter <S%H1980><s%> into judgment <S%H4941><s%> with God. <S%H410><s%>
He shall break <S%H7489><s%> in pieces mighty <S%H3524><s%> men without <S%H3808><s%> number, <S%H2714><s%> and set <S%H5975><s%> others <S%H312><s%> in their stead. <S%H8478><s%>
Therefore <S%H3651><s%> he knows <S%H5234><s%> their works, <S%H4566><s%> and he overturns <S%H2015><s%> them in the night, <S%H3915><s%> so that they are destroyed. <S%H1792><s%>
He strikes <S%H5606><s%> them as wicked <S%H7563><s%> men in the open <S%H4725><s%> sight <S%H7200><s%> of others;
Because <S%H834><s%> they turned <S%H5493><s%> back <S%H5493><s%> from him, and would not consider <S%H7919><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> of his ways: <S%H1870><s%>
So that they cause the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> to him, and he hears <S%H8085><s%> the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the afflicted. <S%H6041><s%>

When he gives quietness, <S%H8252><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> then can make trouble? <S%H7561><s%> and when he hides <S%H5641><s%> his face, <S%H6440><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> then can behold <S%H7789><s%> him? whether it be done against <S%H5921><s%> a nation, <S%H1471><s%> or against <S%H5921><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> only: <S%H3162><s%>
That the hypocrite <S%H120><s%> <S%H2611><s%> reign <S%H4427><s%> not, lest the people <S%H5971><s%> be ensnared. <S%H4170><s%>
Surely <S%H3588><s%> it is meet to be said <S%H559><s%> to God, <S%H410><s%> I have borne <S%H5375><s%> chastisement, I will not offend <S%H2254><s%> any more:
That which I see <S%H2372><s%> not teach <S%H3384><s%> you me: if <S%H518><s%> I have done <S%H6466><s%> iniquity, <S%H5766><s%> I will do <S%H6466><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more.

Should it be according to your mind? <S%H5973><s%> he will recompense <S%H7999><s%> it, whether <S%H3588><s%> you refuse, <S%H3988><s%> or whether <S%H3588><s%> you choose; <S%H977><s%> and not I: therefore speak <S%H1696><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> you know. <S%H3045><s%>
Let men <S%H582><s%> of understanding <S%H3824><s%> tell <S%H559><s%> me, and let a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me.
Job <S%H347><s%> has spoken <S%H1696><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> and his words <S%H1697><s%> were without <S%H3808><s%> wisdom. <S%H7919><s%>
My desire <S%H15><s%> is that Job <S%H347><s%> may be tried <S%H974><s%> to the end <S%H5331><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> of his answers <S%H8666><s%> for wicked <S%H205><s%> men. <S%H582><s%>

For he adds <S%H3254><s%> rebellion <S%H6588><s%> to his sin, <S%H2403><s%> he clapps <S%H5606><s%> his hands among <S%H996><s%> us, and multiplies <S%H7235><s%> his words <S%H561><s%> against God. <S%H410><s%>
